item.title: Monopoly GO: Free Dice Roll Links (Updated Daily)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Free Monopoly GO Dice Links for Today
  • Expired Monopoly GO Dice Links
  • How to Redeem Dice Links in Monopoly GO
  • How to Get Free Dice Rolls in Monopoly Go

Monopoly GO is a fun board game that combines the classic Monopoly experience with cool additional features and a city-building element. In the game, players can move their pieces to earn money and then use that money to build new buildings, upgrade their houses, and much more. The ultimate goal is to drive other players into bankruptcy by acquiring all pieces of property, essentially creating a “monopoly.”

In Monopoly GO , players move according to the roll of dice they get, and the game proceeds with renting, trading, and buying properties. If players have finished their dice rolls and want to get some more, here’s how they can do it.

Updated by Umama Ali on Sep 23, 2024: Dice links are a quick and easy way to get free dice rolls in Monopoly GO . To help you score free dice, we’ve updated this guide to include the most recent and active links. Remember, dice links have expiration dates, so make sure to redeem them quickly before they disappear.

Free Monopoly GO Dice Links for Today

While your dice rolls slowly replenish over time, you can use Dice Links to get free dice rolls instantly. Dice Links are a quick and easy way to grab free dice and keep the action going in Monopoly GO .

Here are all the active Monopoly GO Dice Links for September 2024 to help you participate in ongoing events and tournaments and complete boards easily.

Dice Links

Date

25 x Dice Rolls

Sep 21 - Sep 24

25 x Dice Rolls

Sep 20 - Sep 23

25 x Dice Rolls

Sep 20 - Sep 23

25 x Dice Rolls

Sep 19 - Sep 23

Dice links can only be redeemed once per account . Additionally, links expire after a certain amount of time. If you click a link, and it says "This reward cannot be claimed", then that particular link is no longer valid.

Expired Monopoly GO Dice Links

  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls

How to Redeem Dice Links in Monopoly GO

To redeem these links, tycoons can follow these simple steps:

  • Open a link on your phone. This will launch the Monopoly GO app on your device.
  • All you need to do then is click 'Collect,' and you'll get dice rolls for free.

How to Get Free Dice Rolls in Monopoly Go

Login Daily

Like most mobile games nowadays, Monopoly GO also offers incentives for players so that they frequently play the game. One of the daily treats is free dice rolls, so logging in daily is one way to get them. In addition to dice rolls, players have the chance to win other exciting prizes as well.

Invite Friends

Monopoly GO offers generous rewards for players who successfully invite others to join the game. If a player invites a friend, and the invited friend joins the game, both of them get 30 extra rolls . Players can keep getting 30 free rolls for inviting up to 30 friends , given that they accept the invitation.

Collect Community Chest Rewards

Community chests are great because they offer a variety of rewards. Players can open these chests to earn money, and if they help a friend with a community chest, they can earn some free rolls.

To make the most out of the community chest, players must ensure that they have at least 9 active in-game friends.

Complete Sticker Albums

Players collect stickers throughout Monopoly GO , and they aren’t just a fun part of the game; they can help players get dice rolls , too. For every sticker set or album that players complete, they receive dice rolls. While the free rolls earned through sticker albums are more than those obtained after completing a set, the process of completing an album can be more time-consuming.

Participate in Events and Tournaments

If you want a bunch of dice rolls, consider participating in events and tournaments. The game introduces new events regularly, and by completing their milestones, you can claim dice rolls, different sticker packs, in-game money, and various other exciting prizes . Tournaments also pack a lot of stellar rewards, so players should aim to secure a high position on the tournament leaderboard to make the most of them.

Special Events

Apart from the main events and tournaments, Monopoly GO also has a number of special events. From Free Parking to Wheel Boost, the game offers many events to help you grab some dice rolls. However, their timings change every day, so you can check out our daily events schedule guide to know when they happen.

item.title: TCG Card Shop Simulator: How to Use the Workbench to Craft Card Bundles
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Unlock the Workbench in TCG Card Shop Simulator
  • How to Use the Workbench to Craft Card Bundles in TCG Card Shop Simulator

As you grow and expand your trading card store in TCG Card Shop Simulator , you'll likely open tons of card packs yourself. The cards you get after opening packs can be sold individually for a good bit of money, especially if you manage to get your hands on a rare and expensive one.

But what do you do with all the duplicates you end up with? That's where the Workbench comes in. In this guide, we'll tell you all you need to know about unlocking the Workbench in TCG Card Shop Simulator and how to use it to craft card bundles.

How to Unlock the Workbench in TCG Card Shop Simulator

Before you can use the Workbench in TCG Card Shop Simulator , you'll need to unlock it. Thankfully, the only requirement is to reach Shop Level 10. If you’ve been stocking your shelves with cards, opening many packs, and organizing tournaments in your store, gaining enough XP to reach Shop Level 10 shouldn't take too long.

Once you reach the right level, turn on your Phone and go to the My DIY menu. Scroll down, and you'll notice the Workbench listed for $1000. It's certainly a big investment, but it's a pretty small price to pay for what it offers. After you place an order, the Workbench will be delivered in a box to your storefront. Pick it up and place it in a corner of your store, and it's ready for use!

How to Use the Workbench to Craft Card Bundles in TCG Card Shop Simulator

The Workbench lets you bundle the cards you have unlocked into a new pack of 100 cards you can sell for a good bit of profit. When you open a pack, you'll see that most cards cost less than a dollar. But it's still worth opening them since they can also contain rarer cards that cost tens or hundreds of dollars.

You'll want to put these cards on Card Tables and mark them up to sell for a profit.

While opening card packs, you'll also end up with a bunch of duplicate cards that serve no real purpose. You can't sell them for a good price because the customers won't care much about it. However, with a Workbench in your store, you can finally put these duplicate cards to good use.

Once you have your Workbench set up, interact with it. You'll see two sliders that let you adjust the minimum price of cards that'll be included in the bundle and the minimum number of cards to remain in your inventory.

You can also choose the rarity and expansion of the cards used for the bundle.

Once you've set those parameters to your liking, click on Bundle Cards to create your custom card pack and complete the crafting. Now, you'll end up with a card bundle that you can put on the shelf and set the price to your liking.

TCG Card Shop Simulator offers an exciting blend of card collection and simulation with plenty of humor, like smelly customers walking into your store. The fact that you can use your duplicate cards to make a custom bundle for your customer is a fun little addition to the game design.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Thorny Triumph Rewards And Milestones
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Thorny Triumph Monopoly GO Rewards And Milestones
  • How To Get Points In Thorny Triumph Monopoly GO

The two-day Canyon Climb tournament has ended, and Monopoly GO has now unveiled a new tournament called Thorny Triumph. It kicks off on Sep 22 and will run for one day. Right now, the Desert Tour solo event is also live, which will be available until Sep 24 in Monopoly GO.

The Desert Bloom Partners event is still live, so Thorny Triumph brings players another chance to win Flower Tokens for the minigame. In addition to Flowers, it has lots of other lucrative rewards, such as dice rolls, sticker packs, and different types of boosters to help you grow your wealth. In this article, we will provide all the milestones and rewards for the Thorny Triumph tournament in Monopoly GO .

How To Get Points In Thorny Triumph Monopoly GO

Scoring points in the Thorny Triumph tournament is pretty easy. As usual, tycoons need to land on the board's four Railroad spaces to rack up points. The more points you get, the more milestones you will complete. You can jack up your multiplier to obtain more points and unlock more rewards.

By completing all milestones, you can earn a decent 4,255 dice and 1,940 Flower Tokens. These tokens are used to spin the Partner Wheel in the Desert Bloom Partners event.

item.title: Best Open-World Games To Play If You Love Collecting Cars
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Titles like Forza Horizon 5 offer Mexico exploration with stunning rides, showcasing cars beyond garage displays.
  • The Crew: Motorfest packs 600 cars for online and solo racing, catering to a wide variety of tastes from speed demons to style enthusiasts.
  • Cyberpunk 2077 presents luxury cars for V's action-packed story, blending futuristic designs with real-life inspirations.

Whether it's in racing titles that constantly push the graphical and technical fidelity of gaming, or huge sandbox maps fit to explore with any number of vehicles, there are a host of open-world titles that facilitate gamers with a love of cars, be they fast and sporty or huge all-terrain behemoths.

In open-world titles, what drives players (ha) beyond simply racing or moving in these cars is building up a collection of them, perhaps to ensure they have a car for any mood they're in, or maybe to experiment with car customization, or maybe simply to show off how splendidly rich they are. For players of any taste, there are a few open-world games with car collecting for those so inclined.

5 Test Drive Unlimited: Solar Crown

A Reimagination Of The Classic Racing Title

Speeding through Hong Kong, this fresh racing title would be a familiar name to any racing game enthusiasts from the 2011 Test Drive 2. As well as being a sprawling, free-roam open-world experience, this title boasts a huge number of cars for the player to collect and drive.

Even the starter cars in this game are incredibly sleek and luxurious, and the title's recent release has made it an incredibly populated online space for racing through Hong Kong. Fans of open-world racing games will be very pleased with Test Drive Unlimited: Solar Crown . It's also important to mention that the game will be receiving frequent updates and expansions from here on in, ensuring an even wider array of vehicles will be available to those who stick around for the ride.

4 Grand Theft Auto 5

A Multitude Of Cars Available To Buy And/Or Steal

GTA 5 has a continually expanding online experience that is still being updated to this very day. Within it, as well as the title's single-player mode, there are droves of cars that can be purchased, showcased in garages, and driven around Los Santos. Vehicles in GTA 5 that are worth collecting can be reduced to an elite handful of the fastest, sleekest, most luxurious cars available, all with price tags that would make even a crime lord cry, but there's also a huge variety of less typical, stranger cars available to showcase.

There are, in total, a whopping 347 cars that the player can take control of during gameplay, and each of them can be used to aid in ruthless crime sprees or simply drive down Los Santos and take in the sights.

3 The Crew: Motorfest

An Online Open World Brimming With Cars

There is a host of customizable, incredibly powerful vehicles for players to control in The Crew: Motorfest , and while the game has an emphasis on online multiplayer, it's still more than feasible for players to take on the streets of O'ahu solo. Among the 600 vehicles available in the game, there is bound to be a handful that can go towards an elite collection for any player's taste, whether they're going for the fastest cars, or simply the coolest looking.

Almost any car from The Crew 2 can also be transferred over to the player's garage, meaning that some long-time favorites will be ready to drive immediately.

2 Forza Horizon 5

Mexico Is Free To Explore And Drive Through

The uninhibited freedom that Forza Horizon 5 offers as players speed through Mexico provides a compelling, refreshing experience in terms of both racing and exploration. Car collection in Forza Horizon 5 goes beyond simply amassing a group of them to sit in a garage, as players have the option to sell and auction cars off for an incredible sum of credits, which can go into collecting even fancier cars.

There is nothing stopping players from building the car collection of their dreams and then taking it around a sprawling Mexico unhindered.

1 Cyberpunk: 2077

Untold Luxury Waits In These High-End Luxury Cars

V's story in Cyberpunk 2077 , while obviously changing based on origins and narrative choices, is very much a tale of rags to riches, or at the very least, a tale of starting at the bottom and working upwards from there. The game might be a fairly serious critique of rampant consumerism and the consequences of corporations having unchecked power, but that message might have come across stronger if it wasn't so satisfying to sink a couple hundred thousand dollars into a prohibitively fast and luxurious sports car.

Whether through special vehicle heist missions, or simply working hard to save up for that car players have had an eye on, there's a variety of vehicles available to collect Cyberpunk 2077 , and unlike any other game on the market, these cars are infused with a sleek, futuristic design that draws from real life but adds a heavy dosage of, well, cyberpunk to the mix.

item.title: Skyrim Player Accidentally Hits the 'Shot of a Lifetime' While Hunting
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Skyrim player hits accidental rabbit kill shot of a lifetime while hunting.
  • Various incredible kills include cross-map shots, one-shots, and killcams.
  • Rabbit inadvertently killed during target practice may boost Archery level.

A Skyrim player has accidentally sniped a rabbit while hunting a different one in a moment dubbed the "shot of a lifetime." Many Skyrim archers have hit incredible shots on their enemies, but this may be one of the most surprising one to occur while hunting.

Since Skyrim was released, many players have shared incredible kills that they achieved. This includes a Skyrim Crossbow user who hit an absurd cross-map shot, a killcam showing an enemy flipping after an arrow hits them, and a one-shot Ebony Warrior kill on Legendary difficulty. Rabbits are among the unluckiest animals in the game given their small health pool. Some players have inadvertently killed rabbits when trying to shoot their arrows at Dragons, Trolls, and bears. One talented archer has nailed the "shot of a lifetime" after an unexpected moment while hunting rabbits along a river.

Reddit user Crispo14 recently shared a clip highlighting their experience hunting along the banks of one of the rivers in Skyrim 's massive open world. The video begins with the player notching a Steel Arrow while aiming at a nearby rabbit that's running away from them in an attempt to survive. The gamer tracks the rabbit's movements and releases the arrow, only to miss the creature by a few inches. The player then notches and quickly releases a second arrow which triggers a killcam. The Steel Arrow soars through the sky, passing the nearby rabbit, and flies across the river to hit an unsuspecting rabbit in its hind leg. This surprise arrow shot is an instant kill.

This Skyrim Archer May Have Hit the 'Shot of a Lifetime'

As the player had a Skyrim Elven Bow, they may have just been using the rabbit for target practice. Given that the Elven Bow has a base damage of 13, it can be used to hunt many animals throughout the open world. Sneaking will also significantly increase the damage, making it a useful weapon in many stealth archer scenarios. Crispo14 has confirmed that the rabbit they were initially targeting was never found after the killcam, making them wonder where it ended up. Most of the responses to this rabbit kill reference the infamous arrow to the knee meme inspired by city guards who often repeat their dialogue. As the rabbit took this arrow to the knee, some fans have fittingly adjusted the meme to reference the slain animal.

Despite offering minimal experience, this rabbit kill may contribute to a future increase to their Skyrim Archery level. With the rabbit still having a Steel Arrow sticking out of it at the end of the clip, it may have been included in the loot pool. Given that rabbits don't offer much otherwise, this may be the only thing available on the corpse.
